name: melodically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is musical and pleasant to listen to: His clear phrasing and ability to sing melodically (and in tune) soon found him regular work. Close your eyes, and you can envision her in some smoky Montmartre bar, melodically singing her lyrics.
in a way that relates to melody (= the tune of a piece of music): Those are the most harmonically complex and melodically interesting songs. The song is melodically uplifting, but the lyrics are close to despairing.
More examplesFewer examplesEvery now and then people sing or shout melodically in Portuguese.Not everything Donato played, however, was quite so melodically lilting.My song-writing, melodically and rhythmically, is all about how the vocal plays with the bass.Musically there's not that much outrageously new to that song, but lyrically and melodically it's beautiful.
